ygData.subject: Another question on 30th level song
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks to everyone who answered my earlier question about the 30th level song.  A followup question now. Since it is a known bug that equipping a drum does not
ygData.messageBody:
Thanks to everyone who answered my earlier question about the 30th level
song. A followup question now.

Since it is a known bug that equipping a drum does not increase the damage
from the DOT or increase the amount of magic resistance the mob loses, was
wondering if there is any positive effect for equiping the drum. I was
thinking that its possible that the mobs chance to initially resist the song
may be decreased if you equip the drum. For example, against a mob that
cons blue to you, you have a 60% chance of getting the song to stick just
singing it with no drum equipped. If you have a drum equipped, the chances
of getting it to stick increases to 70%. Anyone tested this? Subjectively,
I have noticed when I sing DDD with a horn equipped it seems mobs resist
less than when I just sing DDD. If that is true, you would think equipping
a drum increases your chances of getting Furfils to stick.

Thanks
Galtin of E'ci
